trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_SEQ_00<tab>Y'shtola's eyes seem to be staring into your very soul.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Alisaie.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Alisaie at the Inn at Journey's Head.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_TODO_02<tab>Search for Halric.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Alisaie.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_TODO_04<tab>Travel to Eulmore.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_TODO_05<tab>Speak with Alphinaud.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALPHINAUD_000_000<tab>At such moments, it is hard to know what to say... ...Are you all right, my friend?
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_005<tab>You did well, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>─you and the Exarch...

TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_THANCRED_000_010<tab>Shortly after you left, we observed that our enemy's ranks were no longer being replenished─presumably when your absence was noted. So we polished them off and came as quickly as we could.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_THANCRED_000_011<tab>...Which is to say, not quickly enough. But then you had the Exarch for company, didn't you, and you could ask for no better than that.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_URIANGER_000_015<tab>Ere we descended from the throne room, I did chance upon an object which, if I have the right of it, did once─
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_URIANGER_000_020<tab>...Hm. M-Mine apologies. Mayhap now is not an appropriate time. Let us speak of it later.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_RYNE_000_025<tab>The only way is forward. So I have to believe that whatever lies ahead will be better than what came before.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_030<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. If you are ready, would you recount to us how the day unfolded?
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_031<tab>...So you reached out to Elidibus at the last...and his heart was moved.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_Q1_000_032<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_A1_000_033<tab>I'm not sure I did the right thing.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_A1_000_034<tab>And it changed nothing.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_A1_000_035<tab>I only did as you asked.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_036<tab>Perhaps you did. Perhaps you did not. None can say.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_037<tab>Perhaps not. Ultimately, you had no choice but to strike him down.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_038<tab>I suppose you did.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_039<tab>But the important thing is this: though violence proved unavoidable, you did at least come to understand your foe.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_040<tab>And in knowing his hopes and dreams do we best remember him─him and his legacy.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_041<tab>So long as they remain unforgotten, the love he and his brethren bore for one another and the star may yet be rewarded.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALPHINAUD_000_042<tab>You said that an ancient came to your aid. But how is that possible?

TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_043<tab>A gift from Emet-Selch. He knew of Elidibus's plight. Foreseeing his own death, he made provisions to bring Elidibus's suffering to an end, lest his friend be left to continue the struggle alone.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_044<tab>Or so I wildly speculate. It is unlikely we will ever know the truth.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_045<tab>The best we can do is to remember events as they happened, no more and no less. As the Ronkans so rightly put it, “History is learned, not lived.”
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_046<tab>(-???-)Ah! There you all are!
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_URIANGER_000_047<tab>My friend! We were given to understand thou wert injured. Shouldst thou not be abed?
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_048<tab>Lie down at a time like this!? Don't be absurd! I would have come sooner had the guards not made such a fuss!
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_049<tab>Now, tell me what's happened. Where is the Exarch?
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_050<tab>I see...
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_051<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>... Will you show me his spirit vessel?
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_052<tab>Yes... Both his soul and memories seem intact. Good.

TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_053<tab>Unlike the others, his aether was not highly charged, and so it did not seem necessary to employ a familiar for the imbuing. But I needed to be certain all the same. Oh, what a relief...
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_URIANGER_000_054<tab>Then 'tis but a question of restoring his soul unto his flesh.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_URIANGER_000_055<tab>And as thou didst lately tell me, the success of this process resteth on no more than our friend's soul recognizing his flesh as its own.

TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_THANCRED_000_056<tab>Given his apparent desire to return to the Source with <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, one would think his soul would be only too happy to be home, no? Surely it wouldn't balk at the relative newness of its accommodation?
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_057<tab>So one would hope, but none can speak for the Exarch's heart of hearts. And he can no longer speak for himself.

TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_058<tab>Furthermore, though I have drawn upon all of my not inconsiderable experience to predict the outcome, the fact remains that there is no direct precedent for what we are attempting.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_059<tab>Will his body accept his soul? Will his essences blend properly? Will he awaken whole of mind? Any number of things could go awry.

TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_060<tab>...Assuming I have succeeded in tempering your expectations, I should probably add that I <var 1A 02 /var>did<var 1A 01 /var> ask the Exarch if he still wished to return to the Source in full knowledge of the risks.

TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_061<tab>A simple enough question, one would think, warranting a single-word reply. Yet the answer I received was rather longer than that. Almost comically so, in fact. Regardless, out of respect for the man, I shall attempt to recite it─with a certain amount of poetic license. Ahem!

TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_062<tab>“As I grew older, the burdens I carried became ever more numerous. Burdens which weighed upon my hopes, burying them deep within my breast. So deep that I couldn't be certain they were still there.

TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_063<tab>“But when I look around me, I am reminded that, no matter how deeply buried they may be, our hopes never truly disappear. No, they are always with us. Guiding us. Driving us.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_064<tab>“I see it in Vauthry, who sought to vindicate his existence by creating his paradise.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_065<tab>“I see it in Ran'jit, who forsook his life's cause in order to protect that which he held most dear.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_066<tab>“I see it in the people, who chose to struggle rather than surrender to despair.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_067<tab>“And though our struggles may differ greatly, since the very beginning of time, they have all shared that one common thread: hope.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_068<tab>“We struggle because we have hope. And when the time comes, I too will embrace mine. I will follow my heart, regardless of the risks.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_069<tab>“And I will live with all my being, as befits one who has been granted a second chance.”

TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_070<tab>There! I told you it was long. And unspeakably sentimental to boot. One would think them the outpourings of a dewy-eyed boy, not the <var 1A 02 /var>old man<var 1A 01 /var> the Exarch seems to believe he is.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_071<tab>I mean, <var 1A 02 /var>really<var 1A 01 /var>─he's scarcely been alive as long as I've been in hiding!
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_072<tab>I daresay he is blushing in his vessel.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_073<tab>Speaking of which, we should make ready for our journey. Time remains of the essence, after all.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_074<tab>Needless to say, once we leave, there is no guarantee that we can return. If anyone has unfinished business, now is the time to see to it.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_YSHTOLA_000_075<tab>I must pay a visit to Slitherbough. Let us reconvene here anon.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_URIANGER_000_076<tab>Hm... There remain some few matters which require mine attention in Il Mheg.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_URIANGER_000_077<tab>May I leave Thancred in thy care, child?
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_RYNE_000_078<tab>Um...I've been meaning to get some flowers. For Minfilia.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_RYNE_000_079<tab>I thought you might help me choose them. And then we could go to Nabaath Areng together...one last time.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_THANCRED_000_080<tab>A fine suggestion. Lead on.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALPHINAUD_000_081<tab>Well, it's back to Eulmore for me. Amongst other things, I owe the mayor an apology about his airship.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALPHINAUD_000_082<tab>I assume you have places of your own to be, Alisaie. I shall see you later.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_BEQLUGG_000_090<tab>I shall take this opportunity to conduct a final inspection of the spirit vessels. Given what is at stake, one can never be too thorough.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_100<tab>As you've probably guessed, I'm going to pay a visit to the Inn at Journey's Head. But I want you to come too.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_101<tab>I realize you don't need to say any farewells.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_102<tab>But the Exarch does, if only in spirit. So I thought you might bring him along, so to speak.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_103<tab>I'm sure he'd love the thought of being lugged about on his hero's back.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_104<tab>So let's be off, shall we? I can't wait to see how Halric's doing!
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_110<tab>Halric? Halric! Oh gods, don't tell me he's wandered off again?
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_111<tab>Quickly, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! We have to find him!

TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_WILLFORT_000_112<tab>Oh, Alisaie! I didn't see you there. If you're looking for Halric, he's gone for a walk with one of the others. They were planning to visit the graveyard, if I'm not mistaken.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_113<tab>Well, that's a relief. Shall we adjourn to the graveyard, then?
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_JOURNEYSHEADNURSE_000_125<tab>Oh, greetings, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! Looking for Halric, by any chance?
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_130<tab>There he is. I was afraid he'd wandered off again.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_JOURNEYSHEADNURSE_000_131<tab>Oh, there's no need to worry─Halric's safe and well. He's been showing good progress, and likes to go for walks of late.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_JOURNEYSHEADNURSE_000_132<tab>Though his steps usually bring him to this particular spot...
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_133<tab>Oh? I wasn't aware he had family here.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_JOURNEYSHEADNURSE_000_134<tab>He doesn't. It's Tesleen. Her sword, that is.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_JOURNEYSHEADNURSE_000_135<tab>We buried it here in her honor.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_136<tab>So he remembers...
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_JOURNEYSHEADNURSE_000_137<tab>What brings you back so soon, out of interest? I didn't think the next round of treatments was due yet.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_138<tab>Uh...no. It isn't. Look─I realize this is sudden...but I've come to say good-bye. It's time for me to return home.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_139<tab>But rest assured the treatments will continue. Beq Lugg will come to oversee them in my stead.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_JOURNEYSHEADNURSE_000_140<tab>I see... You did mention that you and your friends were searching for a way home.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_JOURNEYSHEADNURSE_000_141<tab>Needless to say, we'll be sorry to see you go─but I know everyone will be happy for you. Truly.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_JOURNEYSHEADNURSE_000_142<tab>Happy and grateful. You've done so much for us. Achieved what none of us dared hope was possible.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_JOURNEYSHEADNURSE_000_143<tab>And we'll see to it that your good work continues, and that no more poor souls are buried here before their time.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_JOURNEYSHEADNURSE_000_144<tab>So rest easy, and take care. We wish you every happiness.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_145<tab>Thank you. I will miss you all.

TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_146<tab>But it isn't time to say our farewells quite yet. So if there are any tasks that need doing─hunting beasts, fetching water, and what have you─just say the word.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_147<tab>I mean to make use of every last moment here. After all...
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_HALRIC_000_148<tab>The time left to you...is precious...
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_149<tab>That's right, Halric... That's exactly right.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_150<tab>Those words will guide you true. So never forget them.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_151<tab>And neither will I.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_HALRIC_000_160<tab>Take...care...
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_JOURNEYSHEADNURSE_000_165<tab>Thank you for coming to see Halric, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. And Tesleen as well.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_JOURNEYSHEADNURSE_000_166<tab>She did always enjoy having visitors. And none were more welcome than you and Alisaie.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_170<tab><var 1A 02 /var>What<var 1A 01 /var>? I'm not crying! I just have sand in my eye, that's all.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_171<tab>...Ahem. As I mentioned, I mean to stay here as long as possible. In the meantime, perhaps you could go and look in on the others?
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_172<tab>Alphinaud, for instance. If <var 1A 02 /var>anyone<var 1A 01 /var> is crying, it will be him!
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALISAIE_000_180<tab>What are you still doing here? Hurry over to Eulmore and look in on Alphinaud. Oh, and send my regards to the Chais.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_CHAINUZZ_000_190<tab>I hear the airship crashed in Amh Araeng. Never mind. The important thing is you're all safe and well.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_CHAINUZZ_000_191<tab>That said, we should probably retrieve the wreck before the locals strip it for trolley parts. Or perhaps we can make a trade of it...
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_DULIACHAI_000_195<tab>Oh, thank goodness <var 1A 02 /var>you<var 1A 01 /var> can still return! If I had to bid farewell to you both, my heart would burst here and now!
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_DULIACHAI_000_196<tab>Like Alphinaud, I know that yours is a life of constant employment, but do visit us from time to time. It would mean the world to us.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_WRENDEN_000_200<tab>I understand the Exarch will be leaving with you. Capable though its custodians are, the Crystarium will be poorer for his absence.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_WRENDEN_000_201<tab>It seems the coming years will be a period of transition for both of our cities... But through mutual cooperation, I am confident we will find a way forward.

TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALPHINAUD_000_210<tab>'Tis a strange feeling, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. To stand in the company of our friends, knowing that I will never see them again... I struggle to reconcile it in my mind.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALPHINAUD_000_211<tab>But this I know: I shall cherish my memories of Norvrandt─of every soul I met here─for the rest of my days.
TEXT_LUCKMI109_03779_ALPHINAUD_000_212<tab>And I shall look forward to your tales of their endeavors.
